meanings.definition: The quality or state of being measurable.
meanings.sent1: The mensurability of the ingredients in the recipe made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on the mensurability of data to draw accurate conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The mensurability of the clown's jokes had everyone laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her mensurability in managing time was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The mensurability of the mountain's height took our breath away.

meanings.definition: The ability to be measured or quantified.
meanings.sent1: The mensurability of the distance between the two cities helped in planning the road trip.
meanings.sent2: In science, the mensurability of variables is crucial for conducting experiments.
meanings.sent3: The mensurability of the cat's cuteness factor was off the charts.
meanings.sent4: His mensurability in solving complex problems was unmatched in the team.
meanings.sent5: The mensurability of the ocean's depth amazed the divers.
